title: Unemployment rate in Belgium 2008 - 2018 , by region
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Flemish Region, Brussels-Capital Region, and Walloon Region. The y axis indicates the Employment rate and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Brussels-Capital Region, and Walloon Region are gradually decreasing, Flemish Region is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Employment rate in descending order is: 1. Brussels-Capital Region, 2. Walloon Region, and lastly, 3. Flemish Region.
Throughout the period, Brussels-Capital Region generally had the highest Employment rate relative to others with an average of 16.77, and it reached its maximum at 2013 with a value of 19.3.
After Brussels-Capital Region, Walloon Region overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 10.6, peaking at 2015.
Flemish Region mostly had the least Employment rate with a mean value of 4.65, which peaked at 2010, and 2015 with a value of 5.2.
The minimum Employment rate about 3.5, occured at 2018 by Flemish Region.
